skill.author: metabase

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill with no malicious capabilities. Contains writing guidelines and style references only. Standard Claude Code tools (Read, Write, Grep, Bash, Glob) are appropriate for documentation work.

content.user_title: Write clear documentation in Metabase style
content.value_statement: Documentation often fails to serve readers because it is too formal, buried in explanation, or mismatched to audience needs. This skill provides step-by-step guidelines for writing user-focused, conversational documentation that gets readers answers fast.
actual_capabilities: Writes conversational documentation following Metabase style guidelines
Edits documentation to match audience complexity level
Formats documentation with proper headings, links, and code examples
Applies consistent writing standards across documentation files
Reviews documentation for clarity and reader-focused content
limitations: Does not generate code or implement features
Does not create images or diagrams
Does not access external APIs or web services

use_cases.title: Create documentation
use_cases.description: Write new documentation files following established style conventions

use_cases.title: Edit docs during PRs
use_cases.description: Review and improve documentation during code changes

use_cases.title: Update existing guides
use_cases.description: Update outdated documentation to match current features

prompt_templates.title: Write new guide
prompt_templates.scenario: Create documentation for a new feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Write documentation for [feature name]. Follow the Metabase style guide. Include prerequisites, step-by-step instructions, and examples.

prompt_templates.title: Edit existing doc
prompt_templates.prompt: Review and edit [file path] documentation. Make it more conversational, lead with the action, and ensure examples work.

prompt_templates.title: Format markdown
prompt_templates.prompt: Format [file path] documentation using prettier. Ensure proper heading hierarchy, descriptive links, and consistent code formatting.

prompt_templates.title: Apply style guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Review [file path] against the Metabase style guide. List all style violations and provide corrected versions of each.

output_examples.input: Write a section about configuring SAML authentication
output: ‚Ä¢ Lead with the action: 'Set up SAML authentication'
‚Ä¢ Use descriptive heading: 'Configure SAML for single sign-on'
‚Ä¢ Provide steps in order: 1. Get credentials, 2. Configure identity provider, 3. Test connection

best_practices: Lead with what to do, then explain why
Match complexity to your audience - do not oversimplify hard things
Include answers to questions you had when learning the topic
anti_patterns: Using 'here' for links instead of descriptive text
Burying the action in paragraphs of explanation
Telling readers something is 'easy' - show instead of tell

faq.question: What tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Uses standard file tools like Read, Write, Grep.

faq.question: Does it work with MDX files?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill supports markdown and MDX files for documentation.

faq.question: Can it create diagrams?
faq.answer: No, this skill focuses on text-based documentation. Use image tools separately.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, this is a prompt-only skill. It only reads and writes files you specify.

faq.question: Why is formatting needed?
faq.answer: The skill runs prettier to ensure consistent formatting across all documentation files.

faq.question: How is this different from general writing?
faq.answer: It applies Metabase-specific conventions like conversational tone, no corporate jargon, and reader-focused structure.
